intro: Bertholletia nobilis, commonly known as the Brazil nut tree, is a large evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and compound leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The tree produces large, woody pods containing multiple seeds, which are the edible Brazil nuts. It plays a vital role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. The plant is also economically important due to its valuable nut production.
